pros: Great students and faculty here.
cons: In some financial difficulty currently.

review_title: Great Place to Learn as a Student
pros: - working in campus administration positions you well to get connected with alumni and grow applicable experience for future careers
cons: - DePauw has limited resources regarding pay for students. Unfortunately wages are low and Indiana has horrendous minimum wage.

pros: It was good learning experience and resume boost through college.
cons: Not many. Covid was a tumultuous time here as it was everywhere

review_title: A sinking ship with friendly people
job_title: Event Production Coordinator in Greencastle, IN
pros: The students are nice, you can get involved in a lot of areas on campus, you learn how to do a little of everything
cons: Absolutely no room for growth, terrible pay, and you’re in the middle of nowhere

pros: Better paying than most universities, in regards to mid-level admin positions.
cons: Upper management and decision making

pros: Good people. Prestigious university. Looks good on a resume.
cons: Constant budget strain. Bad software resources. Poor response to employee concerns. Everyone working the equivalent of 2-3 jobs.

job_title: Associate Director of Fraternity  in Greencastle, IN
pros: Absolutely phenomenal co-workers, peers, and students. Very rewarding interactions with the students and the care and compassion of the colleagues makes this a special place to work. The new changes in the main administration are inspiring and I am fully confident in the leaderships strategic initiatives. Genuinely LOVE working here.
cons: They do not pay well despite being incredibly financially stable. “Good work” recognition is given an a fallacious basis and the review of work accomplishments is nonexistent. Those who go above and beyond are only asked to do more to make up for those not doing the bare minimum without proper compensation or even the ability to negotiate your own contract.

pros: Wonderful students who are curious and enthusiastic.
cons: An administration that is constantly changing and unstable, making it difficult for much to progress or change.

job_title: Work-Study Office Assistant in Greencastle, IN
pros: Flexible hours, great team, ability to gain working skills and do schoolwork.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Assistant Coach, College Or University in Greencastle, IN
pros: Athletic department is wonderful, full of great coaches
cons: It is kind of in the middle of nowhere

pros: Very caring small school environment full of many passionate people who created very positive working environments where you feel like a whole person and can build meaningful relationships.
cons: Not the most organized structure. Higher education comes with plenty of barriers to efficiency, but the structure of DePauw has a lot of silos that really impede collaboration and efficiency. That being said, new leadership is restructuring a lot and many are hopeful, but meaningful structural and cultural change will likely take some time. These barriers to effectiveness can take a toll on productivity and fulfillment. My rating is low because of the compensation and because these barriers to creating positive initiatives really make it difficult for me to feel fulfilled in my role.

pros: having a great time here
cons: Need to get more sleep daily

review_title: Good mission, poor place to work
pros: Audit 1 class/semester for free; beautiful campus; good colleagues
cons: Lack of administrative transparency; lack of cohesion among divisions; no merit-based wages; frequent staff turnover

pros: Students, wellness center, music school

pros: A great place to work.

review_title: People Don't come to DePauw for job opportunities
pros:
Flexible work hours
Good management
Career opportunities
cons:

starting wage is 7.25

review_title: Great for Faculty, Not for Staff
pros:
• Student interaction
• Great benefits (if you can afford them)
• Beautiful campus
• Great mission
• Attendance at lectures and recitals is welcomed
• Free coffee/beverages for faculty/staff available
cons:
• Underpaid
• Overworked
• Since laying off 70+ people, DePauw has become severely understaffed and incredibly bloated in all of the wrong places
• Every employee is Type A Workaholic (be sure you can fit into this culture)
• Instability has run rampant in the past 4 years (hopefully this will change with new leadership)
• Administration's past disregard for faculty, staff, and student concerns was frustrating

review_title: Good time for leadership to change
pros: Everyone working at DePauw is focused around the central mission of making the experience great for students. A passion for liberal arts education permeates every aspect of campus, and this common drive helps unite employees across campus despite different focuses and areas of responsibilities.
cons: The rotation of leadership can make it difficult to have a driving vision within each division of the University, and there are often competing goals that make it hard for those doing the "grunt" work to get much done. Collaboration between faculty and staff is also difficult, with the faculty often coming off as though they feel superior to the staff.

review_title: Used to be a great place to work
pros: Small campus, easy to get to know co-workers, great access to world class speakers and performers; great fitness center and on-campus health clinic for employees
cons: Massive changes to health benefits hit the lowest earners the hardest; have to now "earn" your HSA funds; faculty are entitled and make is impossible for the administration to succeed.  Becoming an increasingly toxic culture for all.

pros: Up until 10 years ago, DePauw attracted intellectually curious students willing to learn from intellectually driven faculty. The university flourished.
cons: Nationwide events and changes in cultural values exposed the university for the eager sheep it was, following downward trends in activism that masqueraded as intellect. Enrollments have been declining, as politically driven faculty care more about pushing their political agendas instead of stirring scholarly thought. The leftward lurch of the university continues unchecked, despite the hollow drumbeat of diversity. In fact, the more it preaches diversity, the more it guarantees conformity.

review_title: Howell Professor of Political Science; Director of Peace and Conflict Studies Program
job_title: Howell Professor of Political Science and Director of Conflict Studies in Greencastle, IN
pros: collegial atmosphere, creative/intellectual freedom, a good mix of emphases on research and teaching with plenty of freedom to pursue relevant consulting.
cons: 1) Complete abdication of responsibility by former president to lead on matters of great concern to students, staff and faculty (i.e., power, privilege and diversity). Having left them to fester, he left just as the long ignored chickens came home to roost. 2) isolation in rural indiana

job_title: International Student Services in Greencastle, IN
pros: Generally, the environment is inclusive (and where it isn't, they're actively addressing the situation), pay is reasonable, students are great to work with
cons: Greencastle is a tiny, tiny town. BUT it is fairly close to Indianapolis and Bloomington (40-60 minute commute). So, this is only way bad if you want a cool place to live but can't take driving in to work.

job_title: Web Development Intern in Greencastle, IN
pros: Very flexible hours, can work anytime you want as long as you can put in a total of 15-20 hours per 2 week. Demanding host (I work with the Dean of Academic life) so you'll definitely work very hard and, as a result, learn a lot.
cons: You'll mostly work alone. I enjoy working alone as a web developer, but not everyone has the same preference.

pros: Worked with a staff of wonderful individuals from the University. The students are all very engaged in the work, making for a high energy culture.
cons: This was a student mentor position on campus, and I don't have any cons to share about the experience. It was truly wonderful over all.

pros: Fantastic facilities and dedicated staff. Well-educated youth working to be quality athletes and students.
cons: Nothing at all. Solid school that seems to be only getting better as the years pass. Could work more on benefits for graduate students.

pros: As a DePauw tour guide, I'm given an incredible amount of trust and responsibility. I greatly enjoy being an ambassador to parents and prospective students.
cons: Benefits for tour guides, like admissions jackets, are a great incentive, and should be utilized more.

pros: Really good co worker. inexpensive to live.
cons: Low salary for staff. Grrencastle town has nothing in there. So you may not like it. It does not even have a community college.

pros: Great environment, good people, interesting and motivated staff
cons: We are in Greencastle, IN and not a lot happens outside of campus.

pros: It's good money and helps students.
